channel.title: Python on Dang-Khoa's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Python on Dang-Khoa's blog

item.title: Log: Found a bag of gems
item.description: I just found a bag of gems from Peter Norvig, the author of Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, which in my opinion is the must-read book for anyone who truly want to learn about AI. How to solve constraint optimization in Python? I immediately think about OR-Tools which is the prominent library for solving discrete and integer optimization. The main drawback is that I do not know whether it can integrate into numerical library, especially deep learning frameworks such as Theano, Tensorflow, etc.

item.title: Log: Rust and OOP in Python
item.description: Rust Rust is really interesting. It is much easier to implement the total order with several default methods than that of C++. Python Avoid the unexpected keyword arguments passed to function error: Put **kwargs in the end of argument list in the function definition: def f(a): print("Definitely error") d = {'a':10, 'c':20} f(d) def f1(a, **kwargs): print("Problem solved") f1(d) To design the interface mechanism in Python, we can use the abc (Abstract Base Classes) module.
